meanings.definition: A noisy and excited situation or event.
meanings.sent1: The children's birthday party was full of hooplas and laughter.
meanings.sent2: The circus was a hooplas of colors, music, and fun.
meanings.sent3: The hooplas at the concert made everyone dance and sing along.
meanings.sent4: The city streets were a hooplas of honking cars and bustling crowds.
meanings.sent5: The hooplas of the New Year's Eve fireworks lit up the sky with joy.

meanings.definition: Excessive or exaggerated publicity or fanfare.
meanings.sent1: The product launch had so much hooplas with banners and confetti.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity's arrival caused a hooplas of flashing cameras and cheers.
meanings.sent3: The hooplas around the new movie premiere had everyone talking.
meanings.sent4: The political campaign was a hooplas of speeches and promises.
meanings.sent5: The hooplas of the grand opening attracted a large crowd to the store.
